detailed_info.name: Shea Butter
detailed_info.description:
Shea butter is obtained from the fruit (nuts) of shea tree, a tree mainly present on the African continent. It is composed mainly of triglycerides, fatty acids, esters of wax and active ingredients: among them, vitamins (A, D, E), resinous esters, phytosterols, latex.
It is used in many cosmetics for its soothing and softening properties for the epidermis. It can also protect the skin and scalp from many external aggressions.

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics

detailed_info.name: Shea butter extract
detailed_info.description:
Vitellaria paradoxa (formerly Butyrospermum parkii), commonly known as shea tree, shi tree (), or vitellaria, is a tree of the Sapotaceae family. It is the only species in genus Vitellaria, and is indigenous to Africa. The shea fruit consists of a thin, tart, nutritious pulp that surrounds a relatively large, oil-rich seed from which shea butter is extracted. It's a deciduous tree usually 7–15 m tall, but has reached 25 m and a trunk diameter of 2 m. [1]
The shea tree is a traditional African food plant. It has been claimed to have potential to improve nutrition, boost food supply in the "annual hungry season", foster rural development, and support sustainable landcare.

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine
